Oh and we had the homemade cheesecake and tiramisu...we were full and happy. Service was great! Watch out! We'll be back for more!

I'll start by saying I'm really more a fan of Chicago style stuffed pizza, but Lorenzo's is the bomb. 

We always carryout and typically it's pizza and wings. After frequenting another place closer to our home several times we tried Lorenzo's and it's our new carryout spot. 

Living in Desert Ridge there aren't many good dining options other than Brooklyn's Best bagels which is fantastic by the way. So making the 6 mile trip to Lorenzo's is well worth it.

Generally don't go for takeout, but we were all in a pizza mood.  Decided to get takeout from Lorenzo's and it was sinfully good.  Ordered the everything pizza and the garlic knots.  
The pizza was pretty good; huge slices, lots of yummy toppings and a bit over-greasy.  
The garlic knots were little gems of carb-y goodness.  Dipped in ranch, or marinara, or even plain, I couldn't get enough.  Split between 4 people, one order went too quick!

Lorenzo's is great Italian food at a great price and I think salad is included with every entree. Tony is always our waiter and he always remembers what myself and everyone from my family eats and drinks. I highly recommend the penne pesto with chicken.

Pizza is delicious and a slice or two for lunch is so affordable. You must try the buffalo chicken pizza! Unfortunately, the last time I was in there, there was some inner-company tension going on with an argument in front of paying customers. It was definitely uncomfortable so i hope they can work on customer service.

Delicious Sicilian pizza! I'm Argentinian and I love my pizza thick, I tried other pizzas in the States but since moving to Phoenix Lorenzo's was the best pizza I ever tried. Everything is delicious, the place is very nice and cozy and the people super friendly

Worst delivery of my life. Pizza must've slid around in delivery vehicle because the pizza is half a pile of cheese and half just burnt Crust attached you can see the photos of the pizza I received. pizza is demolished and the bottom is clearly burnt. Paid a lot of money for nothing. Garlic knots were dry too. Dining in here is good. Delivery sucks.

Good pizza close by at a reasonable price. Lorenzo himself delivered our order and was very customer focused.
Recommend to anyone who likes good pizza!

Good place to stop by to grab a quick bite to eat...and it's not a wallet breaker either..depending what you get.

I love to sit outside on their patio. I usually always get the same thing - and that is a slice of pizza, a garden salad with balsamic vinaigrette and a soda...all that for $ 6.50.

The pizza is hit and miss though..If Mondi is not there, forget it. If he is there, the crust is awesome and when coupled with cheese...double awesomeness..

The owner is super friendly, but the interior is often super dirty which is why I don't visit all that often and generally sit outside. The guy from Albania who generally works the cashier is super nice while some others have a downright crappy attitude.

Great experience at Lorenzo's this evening... Service was exceptional with very friendly servers , and Lorenzo visits everyone to make you feel welcome .
Their meatballs are the best ever and their  cheesecake is , too.. Both of our meals : Linguine and meatballs and my husband had chicken parmesan were wonderful !

Two very happy customers.
Jackie Dayton

Ordered food an hour and 45 minutes ago for delivery, and they don't show up. Call to see what the problem is and they so oh, there was a problem with your food, we are going to remake it. When I ask why they didn't call, they say they were going to. I say forget it, and they don't even care. They may claim that local, family owned makes a difference. I used to think it did, but service is equally important. Unfortunately, Lorenzo hasn't learned that lesson yet and now I have to go get McDonalds for a 2 year old that is two hours late on her dinner.
When you order your pizza in the restaurant, you get an order of charcoal scraped from the oven with your slices. Not the best pizza, not very friendly service. Don't waste your time or money.

I've lived nearby for nearly ten years and just visited Lorenzo's for the first time a few weeks ago.  The food is really good and the family is super nice and very honest.  The owner overcooked my calzone, showed it to me, apologized and made another one.  That interaction and attention to detail alone will keep me coming back!

The reason for low score goes to the time it took to get a meatball parm at lunchtime. This should have been a 10 minute event, now 20 min later still no food!

The sandwich is good, the bread light and crispy. All in all good food, just slow.

So my little boys and I found this gem of a place on yelp! The first time we ordered we got it delivered and the delivery guy was SOOOO NICE! He was very personable! The 2nd time we did take Out bc we were so close by and the gal who rang us up was sweet and seemed appreciative of us ordering from them. The place isn't huge but it's exactly what a mom & Pop Italian Place should be!! They have a patio too so next time we may dine in! Ok, third visit - take out again! This time during the day. The kitchen staff and the young man who rang me up were very friendly and said, "thank you" to us at least 5 times!! All 3 of my interactions made me feel like they valued my business. Very cool!! 
The pizza????? Omg. Soooooooo good!!!!!!!! We got the Sicilian style all 3 times!!! I also got the Caprese salad twice and it's on point. 
It's yummy!! The portions were really good- not skimpy!!! It's casual and I love it.
Just ate at lorenzos. Chicken picatta and garlic knots are off da hook. Closest ny Italian u can get in north phoenix.  Love this place

GREAT PIZZA! And nice staff! I had called barros to deliver a pizza and asked that the pepperonis be in a smiley face for the recipient. They said that they were too busy to do something like that so I called here. They said no problem! They're pizzas and slices alone and big!
Solid quickie lunch spot. Cracker thin crust with fresh ingredients. More specialty pie selection than other similar opts. Can't beat the value!

A strong 4 stars for the pizza (if you order a fresh new pie, as the slices for lunch specials looked like had been sitting 30-45 minutes).  Anyway, the pizza I ordered was excellent.  This place though loses a star for the customer service as well as the environment.  Nobody comes up front, they have 1 cheese shaker for like 30 tables, there is food and crumbs on a lot of the tables in a mostly empty restaurant (only 2 tables used for customers), the employees seemed to hang out in back most of the time rather than have anyone at all at the counter, and a few of the table clothes were ripped.  Kind of a sloppy environment.

The pizza though, was excellent.  I would get take-out from them for sure, but eating in the actual restaurant left a lot to be desired.

Menu has many different options, food is good, decent portion sizes for the pasta dishes. Service was great, very attentive staff. The cannoli and espresso for desert were a great way to finish a delicious meal.

Lorenzo's has much improved!  I have ordered delivery from them again multiple times simply because there is NOWHERE else in the area to get pizza delivery from that isn't a cheap pizza chain, and we wanted some better quality pizza for workers that were doing construction, handyman, stereo, television, etc work on our new home we moved into in November.

They have delivered much faster, and in fact once I was told they actually put my order in front of someone who called sooner because it was a larger order and would have unnecessarily delayed mine.  Great job Lorenzos!

Also, we tried dining in as a family 2 or 3 times.  One of the times there was a Gila monster right outside the door which was exiting.  Service was great.  They were very accommodating with our baby.

We are taking out of town company there tonight.

Didn't give 5 full stars because they are still rude when they answer the phone sometimes - especially one girl in particular that has an attitude, but that's the only think left that I think they really could work on to improve service.  :-)
Wings are great, pizza is always fresh.  I go hear once a week.

Here's the story; originally from New Jersey I was beginning to think Arizona ..... great Pizza CAN'T be found .....Well I was WRONG. Holy Toledo,  LORENZO'S is the answer . The pizza here is the best I have ever had BARRING NONE. Even New Jersey can take lessons from Lorenzo's . Awesome awesome awesome pizza! Looks as if they serve interesting delicious food here also. DONOT WALK RUN TO THIS PLACE. You my friend won't be one bit disappointed. I am so addicted . I would give it 100 stars if I could. No joke.

The "full service" experience at dinner time is lacking.  It's as if they aren't real servers and just want customers tipping on top of the food prices.  No drink refills.  No follow ups to see if everything was OK. Everything slow.  The real kicker was when they accidentally boxed up my pizza to go when it was a dine-in order, and we waited... Waited... Waited and they couldn't understand why people after me were getting their pizzas first.
